isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS AND ACCESSORIES - Using Master Diagnostics (MD 32) - Diagnostic Testing

svcproc.title: Diagnostic Testing

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before doing service bay diagnostics on engine or vehicle.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar. These on-demand diagnostic tests may only be invoked by the drop-down menu.

note.para: The example is for the DLCII Master Diagnostics. The 3 box system and DLC offer only the first two options from the list.

step1.para: After selecting the desired category of tests from the drop-down menu, a dialog box will appear to chose the specific tests to run.

svcproc.para: See Section 3 Diagnostic Software Operation as to when to do these tests and how to interpret the results.

The ECM determines whether the requested on-demand diagnostic test can be executed. Master Diagnostics will provide a warning message as to the reason why the ECM did not execute the test. See the Master Diagnostic User's Manual for detailed instructions.
